intro: Verbesina siegesbeckia, commonly known as the golden beggar's-ticks, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy stems, which are often covered in tiny bristles. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, also known as the daisy or sunflower family. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture. It is typically found in open habitats such as roadsides and meadows, where it thrives in full sun.
